Name: Shawabti of Tamket
Description: The funerary shawabti, in the form of a mummy with the arms crossed on the chest, is intended to perform work in place of the deceased in the underworld. Tamket is depicted wearing a long wig. Her features are modeled and her eyes and eyebrows are black. Her chest is ornamented with a necklace, decorated with bands of yellow and lined red and black. A basket is slung over her right shoulder. Her body is painted all white and the front of the statuette is adorned by one vertical line of hieroglyphs, giving the name of the deceased.
